Hi,

	I have been asked to do some exploration on JUnit. I have finished ex=
ploration of JUnit and JUnitPerf and am currently exploring XmlUnit.
	There=
 is a funny problem which i am facing currently. When I compile test_XMLTes=
tCase.java (a sample file given) with 

    public static void main(String[=
] args) {
        (new junit.textui.TestRunner()).run(suite());
    }

it c=
ompiles and runs without any problems. 
However when i do the following cha=
nge 

    public static void main(String[] args) {
        (new junit.swing=
ui.TestRunner()).run(suite());
    }

It gives following error:


test_XMLT=
estCase.java:297: cannot resolve symbol
symbol  : method run  (junit.framew=
ork.TestSuite)
location: class junit.swingui.TestRunner
        (new junit.=
swingui.TestRunner()).run(suite());
        ^
1 error

Does any one have an=
 idea of watz happening.


Regards
Pragnesh

Hello,

I was also in need of explaning the advantages of JUnit to=
 both
managers and co-workers. My explanation was like this:

JUnit itself =
is not so important(forgive me if I'm arrogant here);it
is the test-first d=
evelopment style and adhering to the style that
matters. Today you can writ=
e executable and automated test cases to
enfoce the style, and using JUnit =
is one solution.If there's widely-accepted
one, why not use it instead of w=
riting your own with non-overlookable
time( and cost).


Might be a pointle=
ss, though hope this helps.
Regards,
Shunsuke Masuda
